Yes you get a bit more attack power. Honestly in my gear right now I push 64-6500 raid buffed before my 2pc/sigil/trinkets proc. 20 attack power isnt going to do much for me. I'd rather have the agi, haste, and hit.

IMO pvp weapons should stay in pvp situations.
#533SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaejin
Originally Posted by norg
I have purposely listed hard mode gear from previous tiers, since in theory gear upgrades from tier x should make hard modes in tier x-1 achievable even for groups that couldn't do them previously.

However if people would prefer the restrictions to also apply to previous tier loot (off the top of my head, that would mean removing FSoH and Drape of the FG), then I can do that easily.
I think it's reasonable to exclude hm loot. Even if extra stats from normal mode ToC makes it seem reasonable, you've got to remember that hard modes often require excellent execution to pull off, and a majority of guilds who couldn't do hard modes before will still probably have a hard time on most of them.
#534SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Asphyxialol
Originally Posted by Kaejin
I think it's reasonable to exclude hm loot. Even if extra stats from normal mode ToC makes it seem reasonable, you've got to remember that hard modes often require excellent execution to pull off, and a majority of guilds who couldn't do hard modes before will still probably have a hard time on most of them.
In fairness, and not intending to sound like an ass, this entire forum is based on end game play from high end raiders. There are countless tools available that people can use to come up with the best possible items they have available to themselves as a raid group, the main topic should not exclude any hard modes from a previous tiers content. The only exceptions I could think of are fights which require execution and not gear to complete (Algalon, Firefighter, Yogg 1 maybe, Freya 3 maybe). If a guild is still having issues pushing Hodir HM in 245 gear then this is a personal guild issue, not a common issue, and I don't feel the OP should be edited to reflect the issues of a smaller percentage of the community posters here (as most of the posters here are members of respectable guilds who actively progress in content and push HMs relatively early).
#535SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Maulgrym
The first and last column are appropriate as is and are very helpful for their respective audiences, it's really only the 2nd column "No Heroic Hard Modes" where there is a question and either approach would have it's benefits.

I think though that anybody using this column is most likely from a guild that has a strong core so can push the 10 man hardmodes but probably falls behind a bit with the full 25. The reality is they may clear the previous 25 man content once for achievements/rewards but won't likely be farming it for drops. So I think it'd be appropriate to keep it as a 10 man hardmodes included, but no 25 man hardmodes column.

#550SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AtheistGod
Originally Posted by Leperchaun
Aren't both procs called paragon though? I always thought it was if they shared a similar name that procs overwrote each other (kinda similar to improved GotW or something), but if not, then that would definitely be the best trinket combo.
Isn't the effect of the sigil of virulence called Unholy Strength? Because I remember someone mentioning how there was some buff called Unholy Strength that stacked with Fallen Crusader, also called Unholy Strength.

There are very few cases of 2 separate buffs with the same name. Name doesn't really matter as it is just a variable for player use. Everything has it's classification and an ID number in that classification that Blizz uses to control them.
#551SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Khaosknight
Originally Posted by AtheistGod
Isn't the effect of the sigil of virulence called Unholy Strength? Because I remember someone mentioning how there was some buff called Unholy Strength that stacked with Fallen Crusader, also called Unholy Strength.

There are very few cases of 2 separate buffs with the same name. Name doesn't really matter as it is just a variable for player use. Everything has it's classification and an ID number in that classification that Blizz uses to control them.
All 3 stack, and currently assuming you have the full set, since each one has a relatively high proc rate you should nearly always have at least 1 up, likely two, and then occasionally all 3. (Which is 380 str + 15% str, so basically a second greatness card with a much higher uptime)

I searched through the 230-245 ilvl items with Expertise and can be obtained in 10-man only guild
the result? 4:
T9 helm
Acidmaw boot(leather)
and the expertise trinket normal and heroic version

since the trinket is obviously very inferior to the alternatives, it leaves me with the helm and boot giving me 74 + 51 = 125 Expertise rating, an almost perfectly 15 Expertise skill
and I'm an orc, so using the Frostblade Hatchet give me 5 expertise, combined with the expertise in Tundra Stalker I'll be at 25 expertise skill in total. (and if I put an Accurate Ametrine(10exp/10hit) in one of the yellow sockets I'll be at 26 Expertise skill)

I don't think you can avoid the T9 helm if you want to be expertise cap, unless you wear gears under ilvl 232 on purpose.

#562SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Asphyxialol
That is *exactly* what DK Optimize does. I would advise getting quite used to it as it is a very essential tool for DK theorycraft, especially on gear selection (IMO). You can get DK Optimize here http://elitistjerks.com/f72/t71378-z...1_8_24_2009_a/ and the tool which accompanies it as a means of achieving stat weights if you are in doubt of the default ones in DK Optimize (or the various ones posted amongst the spec specific threads) - http://elitistjerks.com/f72/t50274-k...or_beta_1_0_a/.

You will need to manually add your PvP weapons into the system, and you can't specify a certain set of gems in each piece, only activate the gem to be used and then it will provide you with the best item setup available to yourself and the best gem setup (which, of course, you can then take with a grain of salt and alter it slightly based on other specs you run commonly and the gear you share between them).

#573SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Zinfadel
Um, i just wanted to point out, that a lot of the APE equivalents for a fixed 4 pc. set bonus from t9, seem to be based on the crit rating of the diseases to be based off of our own crit rating.

The verbiage for the bonus just states that it'll have a chance to crit, not that it'll have a chance to crit equal to ours. Like the verbiage on wondering plague. I have a feeling it's going to be more like a ~5-10% crit chance once they fix it, as to maintain a similar APE value as our 4pc t8 set. Except that the t9 would be just as usefull for any dps talent spec. Maybe slightly better for Unholy. I just wanted to toss that out there, it's just speculation at this point, of course.

In fact, I wonder if they intentionally left it at 1%, thinking that things like Ebon plague and other raid buffs would increase it's crit raiting, and the bug is that those things are not....

#584SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Bonecaller
Originally Posted by marvis

Was just a bit disturbing for me after reading the german tooltip and testing with bloodstrike, that the Proc was not occuring every time...
#592SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Lajiskin
The proc chance is 50% upon using either Heart Strike or Blood Strike, the effect lasts 15 seconds with an internal cooldown of 45 seconds.

The bonus favors Bloood DKs more since HS is used 6 times in a standard rotation ( with GoDD ) compared to 2 BS per rotation for Unholy/Frost specs.
#593SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Lyssa
Delete please, misread.

#595SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3dr_AllCOM3
They're both in my Unholy BiS set.
The sets for orcs are very different, since you heavyly overcap Exp and most non-set items have it on them.

#597SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Valtiel
Originally Posted by Lajiskin
The proc chance is 50% upon using either Heart Strike or Blood Strike, the effect lasts 15 seconds with an internal cooldown of 45 seconds.

The bonus favors Bloood DKs more since HS is used 6 times in a standard rotation ( with GoDD ) compared to 2 BS per rotation for Unholy/Frost specs.

Technically speaking GoD Frost DW'ers benefit from the setbonus even less, since they use one BS every 20 seconds.

#603SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3zagor
When I last used the optimiser stat values looked somewhat old to me. This is what i got with 1000h simulation for my arp-heavy gear.
Even not counting armor->ap or sockets Titanium Razorplate is better.

EP:50 | AttackPower | 100
EP:50 | Strength | 280
EP:50 | Agility | 135
EP:50 | CritRating | 196
EP:50 | HasteRating | 174
EP:50 | ArmorPenetrationRating | 322
EP:50 | ExpertiseRating | 293
EP:50 | BeforeMeleeHitCap<8% | 406
EP:50 | AfterMeleeHitCap | 68

It has more Strenght, little less ArP and hit instead of crit.

Always take what's the best upgrade for you at the moment. I'm still not sure what the paperdoll ARpen cap should be but as blood I'd figure yould want more str so long as you're arpen is inline. That blue socket also kind of sucks if youve got a nightmare tear elsewhere. If not it's no prob.

Otherwise it looks like a really nice piece.
#607SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Obelisk
Originally Posted by Buggery

None of those is a Setitem, so you don't break anything.
Also, Onyxias Helm makes it unnecessary to Gem hit, and the blue socket doesn't matter, just put a 20 Str gem in it.

EDIT: I'm referring to the first item composition for blood, forgot to mention it.

EDIT2: Now I compared it. If we gem Crit + str instead of hit + str, we gain 14 str from the helm ans lose 14 crit and 6 arp.
But with the actual composition it's just ~7,77% hit, with the one from Onyxia it's 8,14%

On the one hand 14 str and hitcap, on the other hand 14 crit 6 arp and under hitcap.

EP:50 | AttackPower | 1
EP:50 | Strength | 2,84
EP:50 | ArmorPenetrationRating | 2,35


I even tried to manually double the ammount of ArP in the character file and it still didn't overtake Str:

EP:50 | AttackPower | 1
EP:50 | Strength | 2,82
EP:50 | ArmorPenetrationRating | 2,72


My character stats file used:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<character>
<stat>
<Strength>1843</Strength>
<Agility>181</Agility>
<Intel>55</Intel>
<Armor>14605</Armor>
<AttackPower>215</AttackPower>
<HitRating>263</HitRating>
<CritRating>583</CritRating>
<HasteRating>274</HasteRating>
<ArmorPenetrationRating>414</ArmorPenetrationRating>
<ExpertiseRating>161</ExpertiseRating>
</stat>
<weapon>
<count>1</count>
<mainhand>
<dps>232.5</dps>
<speed>3.40</speed>
</mainhand>
<offhand>
<dps>0</dps>
<speed>0</speed>
</offhand>
</weapon>
<EP><base>50</base></EP>
<Set>
<T72PDPS>0</T72PDPS>
<T74PDPS>0</T74PDPS>
<T82PDPS>0</T82PDPS>
<T84PDPS>0</T84PDPS>
<T92PDPS>1</T92PDPS>
<T94PDPS>0</T94PDPS>
<T72PTNK>0</T72PTNK>
<T74PTNK>0</T74PTNK>
<T82PTNK>0</T82PTNK>
<T84PTNK>0</T84PTNK>
<T92PTNK>0</T92PTNK>
<T94PTNK>0</T94PTNK>
</Set>
<ChaoticSkyflareDiamond>1</ChaoticSkyflareDiamond>
<trinket>
<MjolnirRunestone>0</MjolnirRunestone>
<GrimToll>0</GrimToll>
<BitterAnguish>0</BitterAnguish>
<Mirror>0</Mirror>
<Greatness>1</Greatness>
<DCDeath>0</DCDeath>
<Victory>1</Victory>
<Necromantic>0</Necromantic>
<Bandit>0</Bandit>
<Pyrite>0</Pyrite>
<DarkMatter>0</DarkMatter>

<DeathChoice>0</DeathChoice>
</trinket>
</character>

Weapon - Justicebringer
Chest - Koltira's Battleplate of Triumph

Hands - Koltira's Gauntlets of Triumph
Head - Koltira's Helmet of Triumph
Legs - Legguards of Ascension

Ring - Band of Callous Aggression
Ring - Band of the Violent Temperment
Trinket - Death´s Choice
Trinket - Death´s Choice

Could someone help me, how not to overcap the Expertise? (It´s about 32 or 270 Rating) Especially for an Orc like me getting 37 Expertise...

I consider switching Plate vs. Leather:
Wrist - Bracers of Dark Determination (Don´t have to Gem for Hit anymore)
or
Waist - Belt of the Pitiless Killer (Slightly over the Hit Cap)

Does anyone have some better conlusions? I know switching one Item, will not totally fix that expertise problem.

Getting some real statweight numbers would help me a lot.

#611SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Farno
Yarly, I think the only conclusions to be had are that there is a very limited number of item level 258 items in the game at the moment, such only as one belt, bracers boots etc. Whereas with item level 245 BiS items, there is a bigger choice of items, as there are crafted items plus drops from 25 man ToC and 10 man hard mode. I've run Zerek's Gear Optimiser with the stat weightings listed in the Unholy DPS thread and found that the gear you listed to be BiS (even though you forgot the neck and cloak, however there is only one real option for each of those). I found the leather items to be a DPS loss, even though you're miles over the expertise cap.

Considering only 4 258 set items drop per week for the very best guilds, I don't think people would be getting full 258 gear for a while yet. I would suggest going for the '245 BiS' which has [Faceplate of the Silver Champion] as the helm to use, along with 4 of the set pieces. I understand the need for a full BiS, but it's unlikely to be obtained quickly, and it's important to maximise your DPS for now.
#612SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Citgo
Originally Posted by Yaly
Could someone help me, how not to overcap the Expertise? (It´s about 32 or 270 Rating) Especially for an Orc like me getting 37 Expertise...

Does anyone have some better conlusions? I know switching one Item, will not totally fix that expertise problem
I'd consider Armbands of Bedlam in place of Boneshatter Vambraces if you're that much over exp cap.

Edit: Just did a quick profile of your set with some minor changes and came up with this -- Wowhead Profiler. The only things changed were Armbands of Bedlam in place of Boneshatter Vambraces and I added a cloak. It rides hitcap and it's still a small bit over exp cap, but it seems we really can't avoid it since ToGC gear is dripping with exp. I used yellow sockets that gave a 6 or 8 Str bonus to cap Hit (and after Hitcap, gemmed Str/Haste in yellows) and the rest were filled with Str. Obviously the str+hit/haste hybrid gems can be swapped dependent on your faction/possession of a Draenei.

Keep in mind that the above Profiler link is not equipped with Varian's Furor, because it is not in Wowhead's database yet. This cloak adds an extra 13 HR/25 STA/17 STR/11 CR as well as a red socket w/ a 4 STR bonus.
Last edited by Citgo : 09/26/09 at 12:01 AM. Reason: clarity & expanded on my suggestion
#613SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3timmayz
Originally Posted by Defyapathy
Why would anyone at this level of gear have to even consider gemming for hit? I'm confused here, are people just retarded these days? I find myself more frequently having to LOSE hit than even consider gemming for it.
After armory'ing you i noticed you still use several "hit pieces" from lower tier of gear, once you get max dps items you will notice your hit shrinking away. For instance you would lose 137 hit rating from simply replacing boots and both your rings with BIS items.

#620SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Cyrreffs
yo! wonder if its better to have 2 t9 and 2 t8.5 or 4 t8 and t.8.5 just for the t8 set bonus thingy as a blood dk.
#621SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ghrave
Originally Posted by Cyrreffs
yo! wonder if its better to have 2 t9 and 2 t8.5 or 4 t8 and t.8.5 just for the t8 set bonus thingy as a blood dk.
2pc t9 beats 4pc t8 hands down. The extra 200 STR effects all of your attacks, not to mention the fact that you gain more stats from the armor. The Blood DPS thread has shown that 4pc T8 benefits blood less than some of the other specs. I would not be overly concerned with breaking the t8 bonuses, and suggest that you shoot for the higher level gear when possible.
#622SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Evilbunny
Originally Posted by Ghrave
2pc t9 beats 4pc t8 hands down. The extra 200 STR effects all of your attacks, not to mention the fact that you gain more stats from the armor. The Blood DPS thread has shown that 4pc T8 benefits blood less than some of the other specs. I would not be overly concerned with breaking the t8 bonuses, and suggest that you shoot for the higher level gear when possible.
With all of the Str/AP procs, the 4pc t9 is pretty saucey with goDisease, especially on multi-target fights.

I've never used 4pc t8, but unless I am understanding it wrong, 4pc t8 would be a 4% damage buff for Heart Strike if both diseases were active. 4pc t9 would be more than (depending on meta, etc.) a [spell crit]% increase to disease damage.

I don't have any specific numbers on them, but my guess would be that as your AP and spell crit increase, 4pc t9 would start to distance itself pretty well.
#623SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3teiglin
The t9 4pc uses melee, not spell crit. But you are correct that there is strong synergy between 4t9 and glyph of disease rotations, which is especially nice with dark matter.
#624SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AtheistGod
Originally Posted by Evilbunny
With all of the Str/AP procs, the 4pc t9 is pretty saucey with goDisease, especially on multi-target fights.

I've never used 4pc t8, but unless I am understanding it wrong, 4pc t8 would be a 4% damage buff for Heart Strike if both diseases were active. 4pc t9 would be more than (depending on meta, etc.) a [spell crit]% increase to disease damage.

I don't have any specific numbers on them, but my guess would be that as your AP and spell crit increase, 4pc t9 would start to distance itself pretty well.
t8 4pc is a 3.33% increase to about 30% of your damage, about 1% total. t9 4pc is about 30-40% damage increase to (about 6% with GoDD, up to 10% with GoD). While diseases don't play that large a role the difference between the respective damage increases make t9 4pc much much better.

t8 4pc was just really lackluster for Blood. I just realized that t8 4pc will be insane for the new SS. 20% damage buff to the shadow portion is at least 8.5% increase to the whole aiblity and could be more with how SS is double critting on the PTR. Not enough to be worth giving up t10 or even t9, but still good enough to hold onto over a few 245 pieces.
#625SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Arthas
Nice upgrade. I'll give you my opinion though. I think the interface would be alot more efficient if the Item Selection section took up most of the screen since after you set up the weight stats and character info you only interact with the item section. I'm applying weight's to the interface based on what sections get used more. The item's section wins. Maybe you could make buttons that bring up the other sections interface and handle it that way. Leave the stat weights and items sections as the main screen, but maybe in plain text list the other settings in a small box somewhere.

#627SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Defyapathy

Mainpage suggests Strength gems in all slots, and it seems to imply that yellow gems are only to provide meta bonus (which is no longer correct).

If you click on those handy-dandy images that are just below all the sets for each spec you will see what gems he places into gear to maximize everything...
#632SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Yves

#633SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3norg
Originally Posted by Yves
Those handy-dandy images seems to contradict the above explanation, so how would one know that the images are correct?
I haven't looked at any of this for a long time now, and won't be doing so until post-3.3, but IIRC you use the str/hit gems until the hit softcap (ideally in yellow slots, obviously), then once past the softcap, switch to pure str gems. I think it's that simple.
#634SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		ge-off
Originally Posted by norg
I haven't looked at any of this for a long time now, and won't be doing so until post-3.3, but IIRC you use the str/hit gems until the hit softcap (ideally in yellow slots, obviously), then once past the softcap, switch to pure str gems. I think it's that simple.
Actually doing a bit of quick math on it, assuming you're hit soft-capped with 4pc T9, any red slot you should obviously gem str. Any piece of gear that has a single yellow slot with a bonus of either 4 str, haste, or crit, it's more beneficial to gem crit/str for that bonus. Also any piece of gear that has a yellow and red socket (with a similar bonus), it's slightly better to gem a crit/str and str respectively. I may have done the math wrong on the latter of those two statements as it was nearing way-too-late in the morning, but it's relatively simple math with those nice little stat weights on the first page.

I also concluded that in a situation like [Chestplate of the Frostwolf Hero], it is better to gem straight str, and keep the [Nightmare Tear] for the next-highest socket bonus with two or less sockets (e.g. [Battlelord's Plate Boots]). If you'd like me to write it all out again I can, but really it's pretty simple and can be done by anyone that understands stat weights and the optimization it entails.

Edit: One thing I forgot to mention that will likely change this outcome -- this is using an Unholy build using the stat weights found in the Unholy DPS thread. Sorry!
Last edited by ge-off : 11/17/09 at 12:59 PM.
#635SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3APox
Originally Posted by ge-off
Actually doing a bit of quick math on it, assuming you're hit soft-capped with 4pc T9, any red slot you should obviously gem str. Any piece of gear that has a single yellow slot with a bonus of either 4 str, haste, or crit, it's more beneficial to gem crit/str for that bonus. Also any piece of gear that has a yellow and red socket (with a similar bonus), it's slightly better to gem a crit/str and str respectively. I may have done the math wrong on the latter of those two statements as it was nearing way-too-late in the morning, but it's relatively simple math with those nice little stat weights on the first page.

I also concluded that in a situation like [Chestplate of the Frostwolf Hero], it is better to gem straight str, and keep the [Nightmare Tear] for the next-highest socket bonus with two or less sockets (e.g. [Battlelord's Plate Boots]). If you'd like me to write it all out again I can, but really it's pretty simple and can be done by anyone that understands stat weights and the optimization it entails.

Edit: One thing I forgot to mention that will likely change this outcome -- this is using an Unholy build using the stat weights found in the Unholy DPS thread. Sorry!
Obviously the front page was calculated using the Unholy spec listed at 3/13/55, which is much different than the spec currently utilized in the Unholy thread, along with different stat weights because of the different specs. This is probably optimized to the spec and gear being used on the front page.

If you look at the BiS Unholy gear in the actual unholy thread it is much different. You're comparing apples to oranges.
#636SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3ge-off
Originally Posted by APox
Obviously the front page was calculated using the Unholy spec listed at 3/13/55, which is much different than the spec currently utilized in the Unholy thread, along with different stat weights because of the different specs. This is probably optimized to the spec and gear being used on the front page.

If you look at the BiS Unholy gear in the actual unholy thread it is much different. You're comparing apples to oranges.
Problem being that 3/13/55 isn't as viable once you snag the 4pc, so in reality the oranges don't even exist, heh. I did note in my edit that I only calculated for unholy, which is assumed to be 1x/0/5x at this point in time (since the SS "buff").
#637SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		VulcanR
I didn't notice right now,but i'm thinking on doing a BiS list for Unholy/Blood DPS assuming the gear obtainable currently in 3.2.2 from ulduar/toc and the stats weight/talents from 3.3.
I mean it's currently "useless" for us to drop the BiS gear for 3.2.2,especially in a season where all major guilds already completed the entire progress content.
It could be good to prepare ourselve with actual BiS gear that will reflect the changes coming next month.
The main changes from current 16/0/55 to 17/0/54 (speaking about unholy) switches the relevance of haste and armor penetration:
Attack Power 1.0 -> same?
Strength 3.05 -> same
Crit Rating w/ 4P T9 2.38 -> 2.31
Haste Rating 2.19 -> 1.53
Armor Penetration 1.37 -> 1.88
This will sure put actually on the top [Helm of Thunderous Rampage] instead of [Thassarian's Helmet of Triumph] and [Koltira's Legplates of Triumph] instead of [Legguards of Ascension].
But what about the rest?I feel that due to the lack of choice in ilvl 258 gear,there will be not that big changes..

About blood the stats doesnt seem to change so much,the biggest difference can be the less weight of crit assuming 4 t9,and maybe also assuming 2t9+2t10.
It's hard to say if arp will have more relevance in blood (in unholy does due to the change of talents and ss mechanics) that actually does,and note that we have 3/5 t10 with passive arp on it.
Last edited by VulcanR : 11/23/09 at 2:18 PM.
#638SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3neomasterc
Originally Posted by Yves
The mainpage isn't exactly too clear when it comes to gems.
Is it correctly assumed that Etched Ametrine is the gem of choice in all yellow sockets but ONLY if it provides a socket bonus?
-If yes, I suppose that would only be until hit-cap is eventually hit, putting crit+strength yellow gem in favor, correct?

Mainpage suggests Strength gems in all slots, and it seems to imply that yellow gems are only to provide meta bonus (which is no longer correct).
From a pure stat weighing point of view, difference for yellow gemming for unholy 4p is. 20 str vs 10 str 10 crit =20*3.05 -10*3.05-10*2.38=6.7
6.7/3.05=2.2
So for every socket bonus that gives 3 str or more PER yellow gem, gem 10 str 10 crit for unholy 4p.
Atleast thats the way I interpret it.
#639SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3neomasterc

Here is my result.



Interestingly, there is alot of non-plate/str gear.

#641SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Kaejin
Some questions about trinkets: How much better is Deathbringer's Will than Death's Choice? What sort of information is available on Deathbringer's Will? I believe in the unholy thread someone mentioned that unholy DKs are limited to the Str, Haste, and Crit buffs. Is it determined by class, meaning we have no chance to get the other buffs it can proc? ICD? Duration? Etc...

Also, could the Tiny Abomination in a Jar theoretically be better than either at any point? Without knowing the proc rate, I imagine it would be difficult to come to a definite answer, but after finding the item on the armory database I've become a bit curious if it would prove to be any good, or at least good enough to substitute until either of the BiS trinkets.

#642SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Neiji
I got it and for a Blood DK you're limited to STR, Crit and ArP buff.
So it's quite good for us

For Blood, it's clearly the best trinket available for the moment.
#643SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Manveru
Around 90 seconds ICD. The bad thing is: the proc is completely random. Get unlucky and you're stuck with sub-par stat. I'd rather take the 258 version of Death's Choice, at least I know what I get
#644SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Knaledge
Perhaps an interesting situation:

I recently joined a top guild on my server and they are supportive of me joining and wanting to jump in on 10m H runs and eventuallly 25H.

As 2H Unholy (AoE), I am 17/0/54 (w/o Reaping), avg iLvl of 220~. I started buying the 232 T9 pieces with Triumph badges. I have:

My gear
- T9 Helm (232)
- T9 Shoulders (232)
- Titansteel Razorplate (245, crafted chest)
- T9 Gloves (232)
- Staggering Legplates (219, ToC Heroic pants)

The question: I just got a ToC 25 Trophy (T9 245 trade-in). Which piece of tier gear, to a UH DK, is the best to purchase in the long run? Which piece should I use the trophy on? I know I need to get 4pc so legs seems obvious - but is that the best choice in terms of using the trophy?

I'm thinking perhaps I should GM ticket my helm (just bought it for 50 badges) and get the T9 245 helm? I'm just wondering what is the "top piece of tier gear" to own. Otheriwse, I'm just going to use the trophy on the legs.

Thanks in advance! Searched the thread but nothing seemed to indicate this.

#649SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Touarex
So I just got my hands in Deathbringers will and wanted to test it out. Now I dont know how far you guys are in the BiS frost set, but as i run a mac I can run your sims so I have to do testing in the old way.

I finished the fight against Saurfang with around 7,1k dps with Greatness equiped. I then joined a ToC pug and wanted to see what this new trink was all about.
Now I may have been unlucky with the procs, but I mostly saw arpen procs. Strenght procc's had some bad timing and I never saw the crit proc at all.
I hardly came above 5k dps, so this was a massive decrease in dps for me.

I need to test it again when i reach Saurfang again for the test to be fair, but it doesnt look good. Atleast not in my case

PS: forgot to mention that Im Frost DW 53/18
#650SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		• Darkside
So you were seeing ArPen, Crit and Strength procs then? I've been trying to confirm conclusively which set of procs a Frost DK will get and so far you're my second data point.

You were most likely unlucky with procs. The only way to be certain would be to grab an addon like proculus or procodile and sit idle at a target dummy for an hour so, auto-attacking and recording your results.

#653SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Glimpse
Nice Tier 10 lists.

If I could make one request, since a certain amount of players won't see Shadowmourne, would it be possible to make some lists using Heroic Cryptmaker or Bryntroll?
#654SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Pretty sure you just replace Shadowmourne with Bryntroll and you're done.
#655SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaejin
Pretty much. Shadowmourne doesn't have any hit or expertise on it, and neither does Bryntroll, so there's really no effort involved. Pieces without those stats are extremely flexible and easy to swap.

A more useful alternative set would be one for those who don't expect to ever see Garrosh's Rage for whatever reason.
#656SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3neomasterc
I think some of the gemming are incorrect. If you are going to gem 20 hit, you might as well gem 2x 10 str 10 hit for more socket bonuses. I'm refering to Unholy horde set by the way.
#657SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Consider
It is, but not intentionally so. The armory doesn't show socket bonuses on items, and that's how all of the heroic items were identified - by the armory, as even sites like wowhead don't yet have most of the socket bonuses (example: [Lana'thel's Chain of Flagellation]). Thus when using Zeracks or what have you, its going to make that mistake and use one yellow where its probably better to use to oranges.

By the time such loot is accessible, socket bonuses will obviously be known, and things will be adjusted appropriately, I'm sure, but in the meantime, one just has to use their own head.

Edit: If you can't get the 272 capes, I believe you simply go [Winding Sheet] in its place, with the exalted ring to pick up the hit.
#658SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaejin
For Unholy, yes. Blood is already using the rep ring, however.

It looks to me, though, that the Blood gear has more than enough yellow sockets to cover the 57 hit you lose from the cape in addition to using 20 hit instead of 15 Str to gloves. So thankfully it shouldn't be too complicated.

At least, assuming most of those socket bonuses are decent.
#659SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		neomasterc
I also think that for blood, arpen would be worth alot more than str in BiS gear, making gemming arpen better. It takes 13.99 arpen for 1 % armor reduction, thus with blood talents we need 90%. so 90*14=1260.
If we adopt more arpen gear and gem some arpen, we can easily reach arpen hardcap. It was calculated on the blood thread that arpen in 4pt10 and with DBW is worth more than str already.

*edit*: I did more sims and posted my calculated APE values on blood thread. Should be approximately in the right ballpark. I'm going to consider additional gear tomorrow (leather). By the way guys, HAPPY NEW YEARS!
Last edited by neomasterc : 01/01/10 at 4:20 AM.
#660SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Kaejin
While I was messing around with the Team Robot sim the other day (to figure out when it was feasible to switch back to Blood from Unholy =p), I found that in a mix of 277 and 264 gear (ie: full 277 t10, the rest 264, since the tier gear is the only 277 in the sim besides Bryntroll) the sim was suggesting that ArP gems would be a DPS upgrade from Str.

It's probably viable to start gemming ArP once you have a mix of normal and heroic ICC gear, so long as you're not too concerned with AoE potential.
Last edited by Kaejin : 01/01/10 at 5:16 PM.
#661SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Varzii
Is the Deathbringers Will acting oddly for anyone in blood spec? It procced one time as arp today in about 10 consecutive heroic runs. I know that its 33% each time and its not cumulative or anything but 1 proc seems very unlikely to me.

*edit* After smacking the test dummy for an hour and checking the parse I realized what was happening, the proc animation for arp and crit is the same, an iron dwarf, so I thought that only the crit was proccing because I was not mousing over the buff each time.
Last edited by Varzii : 01/01/10 at 7:06 PM.
#662SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
The way to test this would be to take a combat parse of at least an hours worth of data on a target dummy. As of right now, we haven't recieved that much data regarding DKs and DbW, so it's hard to state exactly if the behavior you observed was entirely random or somehow structured.
#663SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Touarex
That might explain why I never saw the crit proc. I was certain that crit would make one into a Vrykul.

But that taken aside, I dont see any great numbers with this trinket. It might be slightly better than Greatness in long stand-still fights, but there isnt much of that around.
I would like to think that the best trinks for DW frost would be 2x Deaths choice, but i have yet to see the heroic one drop.
#664SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3neomasterc
Crit proc is an iron dwarf, the haste proc is the vrykul.
DBW is simply amazing for higher end gear because arpen becomes much more valuable as we get more ICC/t10 gear.
Its not just slightly better than greatness I would think. With my current level of arpen, I have 42% as unholy. My approximated APE value for arpen is 2.17 (Self calculated), thus definitely more valuable than 90 str. Also, the proc is 600 str, 600 haste, 600 crit is definitely worth more than the 300 str proc from DMCG in terms of stat weighing. The ICD for DBW is longer but the uptime is ~28% vs 33% from DMCG. Also, it seems to have different procs for different specs and classes.
Apparently it procs arpen for blood, but does not for unholy.

I'm going to afk auto attack the dummy for a while and track the procs with procodile in the near future to see if the proc rate for each individual buff is indeed random or stat based.

#668SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by Konata
The swords aren't unique so there is no problem with having 2 of the same ones. They are BiS and pretty much the only weapons for DW frost to use.

Double wills is possible, but probably isn't optimal since the procs can't stack I believe.

The procs would stack since they have different spell IDs, but you can't equip both unless the blues are changing their minds.
#669SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Muram
Regarding the 4 pieces of T10 that would be best to gear around. (Unholy)

I've been trying to determine a gear set early and haven't seen a feasible way to use the crafted Legplates of Painful Death - Item - World of Warcraft without falling too far below hit and expertise caps; At least a way that doesn't involve loading down your gem slots with those stats.

Has anyone planned on a worthwhile way of making use of these legplates? The way I see it it looks far easier to use Marrowgar's Gendarme's Cuirass - Item - World of Warcraft and compensate for the lost ArP with your offset pieces.
#670SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaejin
Is there a problem with using 5/5? One would assume it's suggested to do so on most of the lists in the OP for a reason.
#671SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Alyse
You may also want to keep in mind that expertise as highly valued as some other stats in the unholy spec - you may be better to simply forgo the cap and pick up some other stats in terms of theoretical DPS; how much you value the rotation stability that the expertise generates is up to you.
#672SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Sakuratei
Originally Posted by Kaejin
Is there a problem with using 5/5? One would assume it's suggested to do so on most of the lists in the OP for a reason.
It's all about stat allocation. Wearing four pieces gives you the bonus, wearing five doesn't give you anything extra. As an example, if the fifth piece has Hit on it, and you already have enough hit without it, you don't really need to get the fifth piece.

In t10's case the stat allocation is pretty generous and that's why you see 5/5 in most of the BiS sets. However, I predict that the final sets might change a bit when we find out what the Strength Ashen Verdict ring is gonna look like.
#673SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3wolfetx
Is there any chance you could add the sets 3 and 4 bis sets for t10?
#674SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3

Originally Posted by Sakuratei
It's all about stat allocation. Wearing four pieces gives you the bonus, wearing five doesn't give you anything extra. As an example, if the fifth piece has Hit on it, and you already have enough hit without it, you don't really need to get the fifth piece.

In t10's case the stat allocation is pretty generous and that's why you see 5/5 in most of the BiS sets. However, I predict that the final sets might change a bit when we find out what the Strength Ashen Verdict ring is gonna look like.
It was supposed to be a rhetorical question, but yes. I would expect Arthas loot to have more effect on the final version of these lists, though. Unless the ring has a large amount of expertise on it.

Originally Posted by Smashing
Has anyone seen the stats of the new version ?
Requires The Ashen Verdict - Friendly


Ashen Band of Might

+91 Strength
+91 Stamina
Equip: Improves critical strike rating by 53.
Equip: Improves hit rating by 53.


Requires The Ashen Verdict - Honored


Ashen Band of Greater Might

+98 Strength
+98 Stamina
Equip: Improves critical strike rating by 57.
Equip: Improves hit rating by 57.


Requires The Ashen Verdict - Revered


Ashen Band of Unmatched Might

+98 Strength
+98 Stamina
Equip: Improves critical strike rating by 57.
Equip: Improves hit rating by 57.
Equip: Chance on hit to increase your attack power by 480 for 10 sec.


Requires The Ashen Verdict - Exalted


Ashen Band of Endless Might

+99 Strength
+107 Stamina
Yellow Socket
Socket Bonus: +4 Strength
Equip: Improves critical strike rating by 59.
Equip: Improves hit rating by 59.
Equip: Chance on hit to increase your attack power by 480 for 10 sec.
Source: World of Warcraft - English (NA) Forums -> Stats on the Ashen Verdict Strength ring

#688SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3vdgmasterx
I'll link my current weights from Kahorie's sim if that will help at all.

EP AttackPower 1 (0.74 DPS/per AP)
EP Strength 2.7
EP Agility 1.51
EP CritRating 1.92
EP HasteEstimated 1.11
EP HasteRating1 1.38
EP ArmorPenetrationRating 2.16
EP ExpertiseRating 2.84
BeforeMeleeHitCap<8% 3.1
EP SpellHitRating 1.12
EP WeaponDPS 6.89
EP WeaponSpeed 445.95
After spell hit cap 0.49


Notice how high Armor Pen is. It'll probably be worth even more in better gear.

#692SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Fyrestryke
Pretty sure anytime you get 3+ Str from socket bonus for a single yellow (double for 2 yellows) you should use an Ametrine. It would give you the option to either drop Icewalker for Assault and use the hit version, or leave the enchant as is and use the Crit version and still remain hit capped.
Looking closer the same should be true of the following 4 items in that set:
Might of Blight
Ashen Band of Endless Might
Polar Bear Claw Bracers
Might of the Ocean Serpent

I didn't look at any other sets due to the fact that this is the one I'm likely to be stuck with for a long time.
